decision_conditions: The proposed extensions, by reason of the general siting of the host dwelling, size, scale, bulk and massing of the extensions, would result in an excessive, bulky, dominant, overbearing, cramped and visually intrusive/jarring form of overdevelopment that would fail to harmonise with the architectural composition of the original dwelling, would be detrimental to the character, appearance and symmetry of the subject row of bungalows of which it forms a relation to and to the visual amenities of the street scene and the surrounding area. Therefore the proposal would be contrary to Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 11, DMHB 12 and DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020) and Policies D4 and D8 of the London Plan (2021).

The proposed extensions, by reason of their siting, size, scale, bulk, height and proximity would be detrimental to the amenities of the adjoining occupiers at 28A and 32 The Drive, by reason of by reason of overdominance, overshadowing, loss of light, visual intrusion, overlooking, loss of privacy and loss of outlook. Therefore, the proposal would be contrary to Policies DMHB 11 and DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020).
description: Single storey rear extension, front infill extension and addition of a first floor and habitable roof accommodation including a rear dormer and 1 front and 2 side rooflights
